result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kevin P. Dischler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Pay costs.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Do not possess or consume alcohol.  

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete domestic abuse education class (24 or 26 week class).

Obey rules/regulations of probation.

3 days credit in the event of revocation.

(Defendant is subject to a felony diversion agreement with the District Attorney on Count 1 and remains on bond in this case during the term of that agreement.)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin P. Dischler

defendant.name: Dischler, Kevin P.
defendant.address: 151 E. Exchange Street, Lone Rock, WI 53556

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order Permitting Attorney to Withdraw
No special conditions.  Defendant to remain on this during the diversion agreement term.

Defendant Kevin P. Dischler in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advise the Court that the parties have reached an agreement and wish to proceed to disposition.  ADA states that the recommendation calls for def's plea to counts 1, 2, and 3 for a diversion agreement on count 1 and probation with costs, no drink conditions, and d.a. ed class on counts 2 and 3.

Def pleads no contest to counts 1, 2, and 3.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Court orders diversion agreement on Count 1.  State asks that def remain on bond during diversion agreement.  $500 signature bond - no conditions.

Counts 2 and 3 - sentence:  withheld for 2 years probation with conditions that def pay costs; not to possess or consume alcohol; attend, pay for, and successfully complete domestic abuse education class (24 or 26 week class); obey rules/regulations of probation.

3 days credit in the event of revocation.

Counts 4 and 5 DRI.

Defendant Kevin P. Dischler in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. W states discovery is still in progress; asks for continuation of status.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kevin P. Dischler in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin P. Dischler in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Today was to be the date for a prelim. hearing.  Parties have informed the Court that the def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver.  Court orders def boundover for trial.  ADA asks for arraignment scheduling.  Atty. W states he'd like to proceed with arraignment today.  ADA states information has not been prepared; states the charges in the information will be the same as those in the complaint.  Atty. W states that def would waive reading of the charges if information had been filed.  Court states the charges and the possible max. penalties.  Def pleads not guilty to all five counts.  Counsel jointly request status scheduling.  April 22 at 3:30 p.m. for status.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin P. Dischler in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  This is Atty. Waterman's first appearance.  Atty. W states defense has reviewed the complaint.  Court notes Count 1 is a felony.  Atty. W asks for prelim scheduling; states defense would be ready to have the prelim this week if the Court could accommodate.  ADA Forehand states she's not sure if the State's witness would be available.  Court sets Tuesday, March 17th at 3:30.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin P. Dischler in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def has Atty. Waterman as privately-retained counsel.  Court notes that Atty. W had requested to appear by phone due to his appearance in LaCrosse County Court today.  4:00 p.m.  Atty. Waterman has not called in yet, so Court will adjourn this matter to another date.  Adjourned to March 11 at 1:15.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Atty. W's request to appear by phone for the adjourned initial on March 5th at 3:30 due to court appr that afternoon in LaCrosse County; clerk has left a phone message for Atty. W, stating that phone appr is okay as long as defendant appears in person for this matter

Defendant Kevin P. Dischler in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Charges and rights stated.  Matter adj. to March 4 at 3:30 to allow def time to consider matter of counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
